intro: Megastachya amoena, commonly known as the golden spike or the golden lily, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves and produces tall, spikelike inflorescences. Its botanical structure includes a fibrous root system and rhizomes, which help it thrive in moist, sandy soils. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to ecological diversity.
